reviews.sentence: Nice rooms friendly staff awful noise the whole night. The review for this hotel is a bit tricky as the impression is quite mixed. The positive things are The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and we got our room before the official check in time. The hotel is clean and the rooms are quite big and well equipped for a hotel on such a location. The bathroom is small but that is not a big issue. The hotel itself is on a great location to visit San Francisco and of course this also means there is not complete silence during the night. The really big issue is the noise during the night we did get a room facing the bus terminal and to make things worse we also got a corner room with an additional street on the other side. It was almost impossible to get any sleep during the night. There was an extreme noise all the time. On top of the noise from the street there was also quite a bit of noise from the other rooms as the walls are very thin. This would have been acceptable given the location and the fact that it was a weekend but in combination with the street noise simply a kilerUnfortunately this ruined our entire trip to San Francisco as we were too tired to enjoy the city the next day. We complained during the check out process and they apologized and told us that they can not tell the bus terminal to be quite. This means they are fully aware of the situation and do not do anything about it. Given the fact that you pay quite some high prices for the rooms which again is the way it is on such locations and we were fully aware of it I am sure they could afford to at least change the windows to sound proof ones for the sides facing the streets. There are also more quite rooms available and if you get one of them it can be a very decent stay. My advice is if you get a room facing the bus terminal insist on getting a different room if this is not possible change the hotel.

Good Touristy Location. Located one block away from Fisherman ’s Warf the hotel is very well situated. The harbour is very easily accessible it ’s a short walk from the hotel. The downtown San Fransisco is about a 30 minutes taxi ride from the hotel. The hotel and the room both were very clean comfortable and welcoming. All the staff was very accommodative professional and seemed genuinely interested in our travel.

Fishermans Wharf is a bit removed from the financial district but the cab rides were not bad 10. You could take cable cars as well. Hotel is nice enough. A bit dated but very comfortable. The area is a bit dead at night. Not a lot of options for dinner.

Right price right location. Good price Good location close to Fishermans Wharf and the Cable Cars and Trolleys within walking distance to the Piers shopping and dining. The hotel interior decor appears dated and the color palette belongs in a warmer more tropical location. Wifi is free in the lobby but very weak. The furniture in the rooms is outdated but clean. The onsite Coffee Bar is extremely expensive. Cup of coffee 3 donuts and pastries 3 bottle of water 3. Loved being able to sit outside next to the open fire that burns 247365 what a waste.
Good location but room noisy. Location was excelentCould use some sound proofing. we could hear the people walking above our room.

Nice but pricey. This is a nice place close to all the tourist venues at Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco. But by the time you pay the outrageous summer price and then pay for any extra things like Wi Fi coffee a fridge or microwave in your room and 60 each night for parking it really adds up. We could only get a king bed room so my 17 yo had to sleep on the floor another outrageous fee for a rolaway. Stay a little bit further out and get some comfort. City busses are pretty easy to use. Fishermans Wharf is overrun with tourists and tourist money grabbing shops and restaurants and if I went to San Fran again I had stay elsewhere.

Love it. Great location. Walking distance to fishermans wharf. Clean and quite and staff is top notch. Relaxing sitting outside by the fire pits and having a hot chocolate. can not wait for my next trip to the city by the bay.

My go to hotel for SF trips. Convenient for early morning bike rides into Marin convenient access to Fishermans Wharf restaurants. However more challenging to get to the highways or downtown meetings.

Location the winner. Most things about this place are just ok the location saves it you can not get better position if after fishermans wharf area it is second to none. Place really needs an overhaul though. It is quite noisy though downside of the handy location I guess.

Very dated hotel rooms were dingy. Very dated hotel rooms were dingy common areas were dingy you could see the dirt in the vents throughout the hotel. The bathroom have very little lighting you almost need a flashlight to take a shower. When we checked in they moved us from the 1st floor to the 4th floor stating it would be quieter though they moved us to a room that overlooked the City Bus Yard so at 430 am you heard all the city buses leaving in the morning. The only positive of this hotel was the location to Pier 39 it was easy access. Lots of things to do within walking distance. The hotel is in desperate need of an overhaul or update.
Average good location older hotel. Friendly staff.
Good. Location gym and pool all good. Staff helpful Breakfast expensive 100 for family bathroom small for family room and limited space for clothes storage.

a average hotel located in a great location. Centrally located. Staff generally friendlyinternet was advertised as needing to be paid for this turned not to be the case free internet appreciated but pretty standard these days. Our room was quiteRecomendations and help form each concierge was excellent. Laundry service as quick and efficient. We stayed in room 403This was the last of five hotels we had staying in during our 3 week LA to SF trip so have a good basis for comparison. Small bathroom we have traveled extensively throughout the world and this was the smallest we have experienced for quite some time practically need to climb into the bath to be able to shut the door behind you. With respect slightly larger people would not only find it difficult to access the toilet and bath area but also find it difficult to get them selves on and off of the toilet. the gap within which the toilet is situated is very narrow. Cheap soaps and shampoo products. Room was in the loft so no natural ventilation can not open window. Window blind either open or shut. no privacy when open but due to slope of roof window no other form of blinds available. A C unit VERY noisey indeed. Had to stop using it as it kept us awake at night. Took 1 hr and 40 mins for staff to find room that was ready for us. a very frustrating wait after a long journey. A voucher for a coffee was nice but rather missed the point. External fire pit seating areas are great but most of the time completely taken over by smokers which precluded us using these spaces. Breakfast seemed expensive so we ate out on each occasion. No in room complimentary tea bags limited refills of coffee and the usual lack of milk for coffee shame to have cardboard cups within the room but seemingly becoming standard practicedid not use clothing hanging space as it is within the wash basin area with no separate door.
I decided on this hotel because of location and the option of self parking. Location was perfect. Parking very expensive 59 per day I wish I knew before making reservations.
nice hotel in great location. great location close to everything.
It is located a stone throw away from Fisherman ’s Wharf and our suite was beautiful. Also a lot of options for dining.

Overall the stay was alright. Too overpriced for what you do n’t get. I liked that our room was on the corner and the window faced one of the streets. The location was very convenient to Fisherman ’s wharfWhen we walked in the bathroom did n’t get completely cleaned. There was what looked like pubic hair on the bathroom floor and in the tub. Our door was quite difficult to open. You had to shimmy it quite a bit in order to get in. The deadbolt on the inside of the door would n’t lock either. The only way to lock the door was to use the latch. I would of liked to have had a microwave in our room or at least a continental breakfast included in the price of the hotel. I ’ve stayed at 5 star hotels in Las Vegas that were cheaper than Sheraton on fisherman ’s wharf and even get a complimentary buffet. My next visit to San Francisco I will be staying at a different hotel in order to get more bang for my buck.
Exceptional. Great location block from pier 39 and pretty much anywhere you want to go it walking distance. Friendly staff. Nothing.

Great location for walking around the Wharf. Rooms were nice and clean comfortable beds. The water pressure in the shower was very low in both rooms we had. Also beware of “ amenity ” charges they inform you about at check in. Ours was an additional 186 for 2 rooms. We never used the pool.
